text: Robert Norman Munsch (born June 11, 1945) is a retired American-born Canadian children's writer. He is best known for his books The Paper Bag Princess and Love You Forever. In 1975, he moved to Canada to work at the preschool at the University of Guelph in Guelph, Ontario. Munsch has publicly talked about his bipolar disorder, manic depression, alcoholism and cocaine addiction issues. In October 2021, Munsch revealed he had been diagnosed with dementia and can no longer write. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Video interview at AuthorViews * Robert Munsch at publisher Annick Press Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:American children's writers Category:Educators from Pittsburgh Category:Canadian educators Category:People with bipolar disorder Category:Writers from Pittsburgh Category:Writers from Ontario Category:University of Guelph alumni
